title.narrative: Young male economic development through vocational training

description.narrative: Goal Overview: Create self-reliance of 400 male adolescents in Kingabwa, Kinshasa, DR Congo through 12 month vocational training.

Project Plan: By extending the existing (female) skills training program in Kingabwa to include male adolecents, some of these young men may be able to create an income in the wake of the building boom when equipped with relevant experience. The skills training will be half time theoretical and half time practical.

Summary: Despite weak government structures, DR Congo is going through a period of economic growth (expected 8.2% in 2013) and Kinshasa experiences a relative building boom with establishment of hotels, conference - and shopping centers, and the demand for competent construction workers is growing. In response to this situation, HPP-Congo establishes a training programme with relevant construction skills for young boys. The project will target unemployed boys in general, who can document that they have at least completed 6 years of primary education.

Target Groups: unemployed young men between 15 and 22 years who have at least completed primary school (grade 6). These will primarily be found among the active families in the HPP Congo programme Child Aid Kingabwa project in order to have a good support from the family. Indirect beneficiaries are 2.400 family members who benefit from the boys’ increased earnings.
